text: this week on arts meet Patrick Healy on
the Tony Awards and dave itzkoff on The
Weird Al Lady Gaga saga how is it that
weird al yankovic has managed to carve
out a career more than 30 years in
counting in the ephemeral field novelty
music partly by being funny and partly
by preparing for the unpredictable
undulations of the zeitgeist
even when things don't go quite as
expected mr. Yankovic told me in an
interview he can still rely on the pop
culture Cuisinart that is his
overstimulated media-saturated brain on
jun 21st mr. Yankovic will release
alpaca lips his 13th full-length studio
album including parodies of taylor swift
and miley cyrus but it is the album's
lead off single perform this way a
parody of Lady Gaga's Born This Way that
has already garnered the most attention
largely because of mr. Yankovic's public
and uncharacteristically pointed
response when he was initially denied
permission to include it on alpaca lips
mr. Yankovic says he seeks permission
for his parodies partly out of respect
for his fellow musicians partly to avoid
lawsuits and partly to work out royalty
arrangements the original artists retain
their publishing rights on the parodies
and mr. Yankovic splits songwriting
credit with them although his parodies
are likely protected under fair use
foolish they fall into a legal gray area
where copyright holders use lawsuits or
the threat of lawsuits to protect their
brands but after the song and the story
behind it bounced around the internet
for a day Lady Gaga's managers relented
lady gaga apparently approves of
performing this way in an interview with
Rolling Stone last month she told them
that she appreciated the philosophy
behind the song and found it very
empowering
hey I'm really not insane I just before
this way hey we've been interviewing

a sense of who they voted for right now
it looks like the Book of Mormon is
definitely the favorite to win the Best
Musical award which is kind of the
biggest award of the night it was
created by the guys behind south park
and it's a story of two Mormon
missionary boys who leave beautiful salt
lake city and go off to war torn you
John Doe poverty famine kind of a
fish-out-of-water story with a lot of
sort of inspiring touches from rodgers
and hammerstein's a king and I and South

normal heart which is a famous play in

only find room to call yourself normal
you made me sound like I'm the enemy I'm
beginning to think that you and your
straight world are any service with you
it's been getting a lot of attention
because it's sort of bringing the

Foster
recent years Broadway producers have
become obsessed with casting Hollywood
stars in their shows in order to sell
lots of tickets make money which is
pretty hard to do on Broadway this year
the tony-nominated really favored New
York actors and not so much the
Hollywood celebrities actors like Daniel
Radcliffe were shut out of the Tony
Awards Ben Stiller Robin Williams Chris
Rock these are all famous people who are
now on Broadway who weren't nominated
big question is going to be whether the
tonys find a way to kind of strike a
balance between having famous people do
the production numbers and then honoring
both famous and perhaps no names in more
of a balanced way in the actual award
